content.description: Climbs slightly overhanging face up through excellent incut crimps. Crux comes right off the ground. I recommend stick clipping the first bolt or you risk falling off the small ledge you start on.
content.location: Route located on the east facing wall 15 feet from "line between light and dark." Belay stance is on the small ledge.

content.description: Route is on juggy face 5 feet right of Missys' Playhouse.  Climb past 2 bolts to a short crack to the top/anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts and a medium nut placement to 2 bolt anchor.  This route can also be top roped by scrambling up the gully and around to the top.

climbs.name: Ticks on Parade
climbs.fa: FA Troy Anderson and Shayne Durfee, Todd Stephens (RIP) 1997

content.description:
Noticeable Crack above roof to the west of Missy's Playhouse.  The original start is in the finger crack in the white rock then up to pedestal then up the crack to the 2 bolt anchor.

An easier start would be to start right of the finger crack and climb up to the pedestal.
Slab past 3 bolts and a medium nut placement to chain Anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a medium nut placement.
content.location: On the west side of Embryology Rock, 50-70yds west from Missy's Playhouse.  It's the southernmost route on the west face.

content.description:
Drilled on lead, this route climbs up face 10 feet right of

Missys' Playhouse

on big jugs. Good beginner lead.

Route has a hard overhanging crimping crux right off the ground. Crimps to pull the lip are amazingly painful. Once you pull the lip onto the slab it eases up but don't let your guard down because 10 feet of slab leads to a shorty vertical section of chossy flakes(10+). Tread lightly I had a dinner plate sized flake pull off. Vertical section leads to 10 more feet of slab.
content.protection: 4 bolts to single bolt anchor with a Rap link.
content.location: located 20 feet west of De-appendix day. You must scramble up a short hill to reach the base of the route. It is a stand alone block.

content.description: This route consists of stemming in a bolted chimney.
content.protection: Clip the bomber bolts and hangers
content.location: The only bolted chimney in the area.

content.description:
Surprisingly fun line. Line goes straight up the face on edges. Crux is getting to the lip. You will find that the anchors are quite awkward. You will need to bring long slings and a locking biner if you wish to top rope the route.

You will need to rap the route to get down if you like your rope. lowering off the anchors will drag your rope across sharp welded tuft. Be prepared.
content.location: Formation 20 yards north-east of line between light and dark.  Walk around corner to tree below White Harlem, walk across several ledges through oak brush. Formation is a large cone with a small roof at the top. Formation should be obvious from a distance.

content.description: An arete with a right lean the whole way.  Good clips with overhanging consequences.
content.protection:
3 bolts to chain anchors. Shares anchors with

Septic Death
content.location: The first steep arete you arrive to on the trail.

content.description: Long stretch for a sit start with a long throw. Make sure to have good feet!
content.location: There's three boulders in the basin south (below) Sprocket Rocks and Pocket Rocks. This is on the farthest West boulder.  The route is on the southeast corner of the rock.

content.description:
Get Irie.

Start off boulder and climb to the heights.

This may have been the first route at "sprocket rocks"
Route follows four left arching bolts up pockets and edges to two bolt anchor.
content.location: Route is "hidden" on the back side of the large cone just off the approach trail. Walk around to the back side from a view to kill.

content.description: Climb up the slab passing 3 bolts to the chain anchors.
content.location: On the far west side of Embryology Rock, 50-70yds west from Missy's Playhouse.

content.description: The route starts with two hands in the crack, the crux is the bump up to the top holds
content.location: Just south on the same wall as Missy's playhouse.

content.description: Start in Cave and pull out to right leaning crack.  When crack runs out, clip the bolt then proceed up to the chain anchors.
content.location:
Embryology Rock is located about 50-70yds west of Missy's Playhouse.  It is the most prominent feature on the cliff band.

Embryology Crack starts in a cave on the south side of the formation.

content.description:
Starts by traversing up an arching crack. Then moves straight up the face on fun edges. The entire route is dead vertical. Crux comes around the 20 foot mark. Well protected.

My favorite route at sprocket rocks.
content.location: Located on the south face around the corner from Missy's playhouse.

content.description: Moves up edges following three bolts trending left. Line connects into the top of lip before you clip. Ends on the same roof crux.
content.location: Route is located 8 feet right of lip before you clip.

content.description: Moves up slab on shallow pockets and edges.
content.location: Route is located on the large cone just off the approach trail. An obvious trail break off the main path and heads west for 20 yards to the base of the route.
